section.title: Introduction
section.paragraph: This document provides an overview of the key components of a bicycle. It includes descriptions and references to visual aids within a larger technical manual.

subsection.title: Frame (Refer to Figure 1.1)
subsection.paragraph: The bicycle frame is the main structural component, typically constructed from metal tubes welded together. It provides the foundation for all other parts.

subsection.title: Wheels (Refer to Figure 1.2)
subsection.paragraph: The wheels enable movement and consist of the following parts:

list.item: Hub: The central part of the wheel.
Spokes: Connect the hub to the rim.
Metal Rim: The outer circular part of the wheel.
Rubber Tire: Provides traction and cushioning.

subsection.title: Seat and Seat Post (Refer to Figure 1.3)
subsection.paragraph: The seat and seat post provide a comfortable riding position. The seat post inserts into the seat tube, allowing for height adjustment.

subsection.title: Handlebar and Stem (Refer to Figure 1.4)
subsection.paragraph: The handlebar and stem control steering and provide a mounting point for brake levers and shifters.

subsection.title: Cranks (Refer to Figure 1.5)
subsection.paragraph: The cranks are levers that extend from the bottom bracket to the pedals, transferring pedaling force to the drivetrain.

subsection.title: Pedals (Refer to Figure 1.6)
subsection.paragraph: The pedals are platforms for the feet, attaching to the cranks and receiving pedaling force.

subsection.title: Chain and Gears (Refer to Figure 1.7)
subsection.paragraph: The chain and gear system (drivetrain) transmit power from the pedals to the rear wheel. Key components include:

list.item: Front Chain Ring: The large gear attached to the crank.
Rear Freewheel (or Cassette): The set of gears on the rear wheel.
Front and Rear Derailleurs: Mechanisms that move the chain between gears.
Shift Lever: Controls the derailleurs.
Cables: Connect the shift lever to the derailleurs.

subsection.title: Brakes (Refer to Figure 1.8)
subsection.paragraph: The brake system provides stopping power and includes:

list.item: Actuators (on Handlebars): Levers operated by the rider.
Brake Cable: Transmits force from the actuator to the brakes.
Brake Calipers: Clamp onto the wheel rim or rotor.
Brake Pads: Provide friction to slow or stop the wheel.
